website_summaries.verdict: Put true artistry into calligraphy writing using a world-class instrument with a specially-designed nib that allows for perfect line variations where needed.
pros: Can swap out nib sizes to create different script sizes and styles
Sold-separately converter will fit to swap out cartridges for bottled ink if desired
Window on pen helps monitor ink level
Users love the bright red trim’s contrast with the glossy black pen body
cons: Some Lamy fans find this pen a bit longer than other models, making it too tall for shirt pockets and creating a different grip

customer_reviews.title: Lovely pen, but nib too fat for body text
customer_reviews.text: Writes very nicely with Noodler's Black (a.k.a. bullet-proof black) and the Lamy cartridge converter. The 1.5 mm stubby Italic is too fat for general writing (I should have believed all the other reviews) but I had a different brand of 1.1 mm stub and the line variation was hardly visible. But for signs, certificates (filling in names) this Lamy 1.5 is great. The pen itself is very handsome with its red highlights. The long tapered, artist style body will not fit in a pocket, but you can can clip it TO a pocket so that the body hangs out in space.
customer_reviews.author: Robert I. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Really nice, no problems, go 1.1mm nib if you are looking for note taking though.
customer_reviews.text: It is a lot of fun to right with. The pen is the same as the safari other than the body is elongated. I probably should have gotten the 1.1 though for just taking notes. The 1.5mm nib can fit inside the wide ruled paper but it just ends up being way bigger than my normal handwriting. Still its a lot of fun to write with, had no problems with the feed or anything(Make sure to flush before first use!), and writes pretty distinctly with awesome line variation. I was on the edge between 1.1 and 1.5 mm nib and went 1.5 because I like big variation but its really just too big for note taking.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Hughes

customer_reviews.title: I love this pen have had my Lamy All Star for ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this pen have had my Lamy All Star for two years now and was looking for a special pen for my girlfriend to get her in the hobby. Came across the Lamy Joy and immediately knew this pen suits her very well. I bought the pen but replaced the nib with a fine black stainless steel nib for the asthetic and since the pen will be used for mostly note taking. It wrote great just like any other Safari or All Star. This Is a great just because gift for that special someone in fact I’m jealous and will be ordering another for myself.
customer_reviews.author: Eliseo

customer_reviews.title: One of THE BEST calligraphy pens you will EVER own
customer_reviews.text: I've had this pen for about 2-3 weeks now and LOVE it, yes it is a fingerprint MAGNET. this is the second calligraphy pen I've had the pleasure of owning, and i must say this is a beautiful pen that you won't regret buying, it is worth every cent. the ink is great and drys fairly fast and the 1.5mm nib give nice line variation in the letters you create. check out other LAMY products, i would suggest the LAMY Safari / Safari AL lines.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy one you can test yourself, otherwise consider another brand.
customer_reviews.text: Some have noted that these cheaper fountain pens have a lot of variance in the nibs. That said, I found this pen to be very scratchy. Considering how many inexpensive options there are these days, pilot metropolitan, cross century, Delike classic, I'd go with another brand unless you're buying in person. That said, I love the 1.5mm nib size for calligraphy, and I'm going to be very sad to let this one go.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Scheid

customer_reviews.title: pure joy
customer_reviews.text: Great pen. A bit longer and more dramatic looking than I thought, but I'm loving it. A step up from the more plain Safari. The nib it comes with is very calligraphy-like - bold going this way then thin the other way. It's not quite a basic nib but you can buy more and switch them if you don't like it. My new pen came with 1 blue ink cartridge and 1 refillable ink converter cartridge.
customer_reviews.author: M&M82

customer_reviews.title: I love this pen
customer_reviews.text: I love this pen. It writes very smoothly. I love how long the pen is as I have large hands. Most fountain/calligraphy pens are very short, and this is a nice change. It feels of high quality, although the black is seemingly prone to scratches. I don't know if it has anything to do with the pen, but I got some refilled ink cartridges, and the ink didn't last very long. Maybe one of those fancy refilled cartridges (I forget what they're called) will last longer.
customer_reviews.author: LittleGreenMachine

customer_reviews.title: A well-designed and reasonably priced calligraphy pen.
customer_reviews.text: This pen is ideal for writing greetings cards and their envelopes. It writes smoothly for basic scripts and uses the well-tried Lamy cartridges or ink reservoir. It is ideal to have handy for that special piece of writing.
customer_reviews.author: Inter Axion Inc.

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this !!
customer_reviews.text: Lamy FPs are always great, this one is super !!! The length of the pen is different and since the nib is wider you get a lovely effect on the writing without being too inky. I just love it !! 🤍
customer_reviews.author: D. FOXX

customer_reviews.title: Lamy Joy, utility at a good price.
customer_reviews.text: Lamy pens may not be fancy, but they are nice tools. The 1.5 mm nib is a little wide for my taste but I will have a use for it. No problem, nibs on the Lamy pens are simple to change. I had a 1.1 nib to replace it and was up and running in no time. Ink flow is good. The longer barrel of the Joy allows it to feel more like my dip pens. I haven't had it long enough to determine how well it will hold up to use but if the Joy is up to the standard of my 10 year old Safari it will be in use for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin M McCormack

customer_reviews.title: The ink is BLUE
customer_reviews.text: Comes with blue ink. The product title is tricky for people looking for a black pen stating that it's black w/red trim... When what we really want is a BLACK INK pen. I had to buy a separate set of black ink refills for my project. Very annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Gabriella

customer_reviews.title: Crisp edges
customer_reviews.text: Excellent pen for calligraphers interested in Gothic and Celtic styles. The nib is not springy and keeps the hard lines.
customer_reviews.author: Blanche White

customer_reviews.title: I love it! I just started to learn Arabic this ...
customer_reviews.text: I love it! I just started to learn Arabic this semester. This pen makes my Arabic handwriting looks "professional"! I did spend quite a while to compare 1.1, 1.5, and 1.9. For now I really love this pen, and glad I made the right choice. Lamy Joy is different from a Safari, it is designed for handwriting, but not really for taking notes. It cannot write as fast as Safari.
customer_reviews.author: AriMer

customer_reviews.title: I love the smooth, glossy black finish
customer_reviews.text: I love this pen. I had a previous version with the aluminum cap that I lost. Every time I used it I had to spray my fingers with 409 to get the ink off them. This is a common problem for calligraphers, so I didn't think too much of it. Then I got this pen. I love the smooth, glossy black finish. It feels GREAT in my hand - and it DOES NOT LEAK. You will love this pen.
customer_reviews.author: Warren Harris

customer_reviews.title: Wasn’t delivered what I ordered.
customer_reviews.text: The description said the nib was 1.5mm however it came with a 1.1 nib. I wanted a 1.5 mm nib so now I have to buy another nib. Writes pretty good, not great. There’s seems to be an interruption in the ink flow periodically. Maybe this is expected but I bought another Pilot fine point nib fountain pen recently and it flows perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: J.

customer_reviews.title: Best writing pen in town
customer_reviews.text: I had a problem at first with this pen but, I got it resolved. This is an AWESOME pen. With my custom colored inks I'm able to get the results I want while sketching. I got the Black and Silver and the Red and Black. AWESOME pens.

customer_reviews.title: Great first caligraphy fountain pen
customer_reviews.text: This pen is great. A little bit on the longer size but I love the way it looks. The black with red accents looks great. This pen definitely has a sweet spot because of its 1.5mm nib. Great line differentiation and the nib has great flow. Moderately wet nib.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: works great, long shaft
customer_reviews.text: Second lamy calligraphy pen I bought, works great, long shaft, thought that would make it weird to write with, but not the case. Writes great. Does not come with the converter. Just the pen, cap, and an ink cartridge(blue).
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: great entry-level pen
customer_reviews.text: I had forgotten how much I enjoy calligraphy! This is an entry-level pen which is easy to use and is making it fun to write lovely awards for students. Get the converter too so you can choose your own ink! I got this with the 1.5mm nib, and I would love to also have the 1.9mm nib.
customer_reviews.author: Jen O

customer_reviews.title: Writing Cursive with Penache
customer_reviews.text: Glorious writing experience. I don't recommend keeping the cap on end of barrel as it significantly affects the balance. Calligraphy is all about the flow. The wider the nib, the more flash in your flourish. The 1.5 nib is perfect for relearning cursive writing.

customer_reviews.title: Lamy Pens are Great for Beginners
customer_reviews.text: Lamy pens are great for people new to fountain pens, looking for a "I won't freak out if I lose this" travel fountain pen, or learning to do calligraphy.

customer_reviews.title: LOVE LOVE LOVE!!!!
customer_reviews.text: The shipping info was a bit off and confusing on Amazon's side but I got it quickly! I also was able to tell the correct day that the package was arriving through tracking in USPS. The pen is amazing, flows great on the page and so very sexy looking. Little longer than I expected, but still fits comfortably in my pencil bag. I have another Lamy pen and the whole brand is amazing!!! Didn't know that it came with a lifetime guarantee but I'm glad it does. Thanks!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Practical Fountain Pen
customer_reviews.text: Really fantastic pen, it is clean and writes very well, I can definitely recommend this as an everyday carry!

customer_reviews.title: Review for Lamy Joy Fountain Pen
customer_reviews.text: I have been using fountain pens for about 6 monthes now. This is the second Lamy product that I have purchased. This fountain pen is great for those know how to write with fountain pens, but don't know how to write calligraphy and wish to learn. I don't know if I can reccommend this to a professional calligraphy writer, but I can recommend this to a beginner for its dependabilty, relieablity, and durabilty.
